Articles.Content:
I'm writing (or rather, typing) this to say something I have wanted to know for a long time.

How do you play KSP?

Do you jam to tunes? Do you play alone? With a friend? Do you snack?

I'll start.

I play KSP in my basement. The lights are usually on, and it's very quiet. Most of the time I spend is talking to my Kerbals. Poor Ferwin has been stuck in the astronaut complex all day listening to me.

Enough about me.

What about YOU?

Right now is unusual, blasting Katy Perry music while just screwing around with stuff in the VAB (And constantly checking back to the forums to see if the KSO mod is out yet). Snow day tomorrow so yea

"Snow day tomorrow so yea..."

I hate you so much.

I usually play KSP alone, just launching brand-spanking new billion dollar SSTO's and docking them to stations.

The usual day (weekday): wake up. Go to school, think about ksp all day, come home, play ksp.

Start working on my kethane mining, discover something interesting, spend most of the day exprimenting.

Yesterday: come home from school, start doing mining runs on Deimos, discover the universe is pretty much ending, planets are drifting, some are speeding around their orbit, some are not moving at all, begin rushing to save the kethane from the moons of urania cause its plummeting towards the sun, then have a nightmare about Kerbin plummeting into Kerbol and exploding

The usual day (weekend/any day off of school): wake up, play ksp all day, repeat top.
I also put on a fake astronaut helmet and rocket underpants.

I sit at my desktop computer in a chair and play ._.

I'm boring, I know.

Better than me. I talk to computer generated graphics formed by lines of code and imagine they have personalities.

I'm a bit weird.

I like to play KSP alone, although I still hope my friends will pick up the game, and I actually stay inside the Kerbin System, at the moment I'm starting a Minmus base using my newely developed Space Plane as a crew shuttle.

Edit: I just realised that I never use docking mode, I just do everything from stage mode with the IJKL HN controls.

Edited February 10, 2014 by viccie211
I usually sit in a really lazy position and play KSP while Queen is blasting from my headphones .
I am playing in work, not using timewarp, and coordinating my breaks from coding to coincide with manoeuvre nodes
I lie on my bed, blast metal and '90s rap with the game sound muted, I usually stay inside the kerbin system, build shuttles or a comms relay.

I wish I had more time to play the game! But when I do, I'm usually playing in my living room, with a space themed dvd playing in the background - lately I've been favouring From the Earth to the Moon and the Spacecraft Films Apollo 11 dvd's.

I'm constantly writing mission objectives and debrief reports so even when I get the time, I don't get much flying done, it's really getting obsessive!
